intro: Tromotriche longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed tromotriche, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, often hairy stems and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a cluster. Tromotriche longipes is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and marshlands. Its botanical structure reflects adaptations to its humid, tropical habitat.
